content: I've at the end of what turned into a long process to update every posted IG that we have. I've built packages for all of them, filled out package-list.json, and cross-validated all the packages and package-list.json files, and I've automated the status note that goes in each of the pages (that I used to do by hand). All further IGs that are published will go through the same system.

The process has involved a lot of changes to the posted html. Please review any IGs (including old versions) (and particularly the publication history) that you are responsible for, and let me know if you see old IGs that look surprising in some way

bad link for argo scheduling:
First Release => http://www.fhir.org/guides/argonaut/scheduling/release1/
"Data Exchange for Quality Measures (Da Vinci) should reference the STU3 CI build as well : https://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/davinci-deqm/
I can fix those myself if that is OK?
I fixed the first - because I didn't read the last line till afterwards. I don't understand the second...
There is borh an R4 and STU3 version of DEQM CI build the link only references the R4 CI build and should reference the STU3 version only or both
there can only be one CI build
Well then I would prefer it be the STU3 CI build for now and we will merge them in the future
When this happens Lloyd, can you post a link to the new 'appropriate' stream? I suspect it's hard for folks to find..
Sure, my thought was actually moving it and starting a new topic immediately
